document.masterDocTitle: Leptonetid spiders from caves of the Yunnan-Guizhou Plateau, China (Araneae: Leptonetidae) 2587

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Leptonetid spiders from caves of the Yunnan-Guizhou Plateau, China (Araneae: Leptonetidae) 2587

subSubSection.paragraph: (Mostly referring to these characters of the male pedipalpi)

paragraph.keyLead:
4 Tibial spurs II–V located at distal tibia retrolaterally, far from tibial spur I ( Fig. 4A ) .....
Leptonetela anshun
sp. nov.

5 Tibial spur I furcated asymmetrically, located at middle, 5 spurs equidistantly arranged, 3 long trichobothria at tibia dorsally; pedipalpal tarsus with a distinctly earlobe-shaped process ( Fig. 15A, B ) ....................
L. furcaspina
sp. nov.

- Tibial spur I furcated symmetrically, located at base, 5 spurs not equidistantly arranged, 4 long trichobothria at tibia dorsally; tarsal earlobe-shaped process indistinct ( Fig. 11A, B ) .......................................................
L. danxia
sp. nov.

6 Conductor reduced, median apophysis palm-shaped ( Fig. 40C ) .....................................................
L. palmata
sp. nov.

7 Conductor smooth, median apophysis sharply wedge-shaped ( Fig. 27D )..........................................
L. jinsha
sp. nov.

- Conductor rugose, median apophysis fingerlike ( Fig. 14C ) .............................................................
L. digitata
sp. nov.

9 Tibial spur II and III crossed ( Fig. 22A ); median apophysis hook-shaped ( Fig. 23D )....................
L. hamata
sp. nov.

13 Conductor small; embolus sharply triangular ( Fig. 53A, B )...............................................................
L. yangi
sp. nov.
15 Pedipalpal femur without mane, tibia with 2 or 3 distal spurs retrolaterally ( Fig. 18E , 19A ).................................... 16

16 Tibial spur I and II adnate ( Fig. 17A, B ), three distal spurs at tibia retrolaterally ( Fig. 18E ) ..
L. geminispina
sp. nov.

17 Endites with a distinct ridge at middle ( Fig. 34E ); pedipalpal tibial spurs placed on middle except two distal spurs ( Fig. 33A ).............................................................................................................................
L. maxillacostata
sp. nov.
- Endites without a ridge; each pedipalpal tibial spurs discrete arranged ..................................................................... 18

18 Apical tarsal seta of pedipalp and median apophysis absent, pedipalpal tarsus with a mesial and a basal seta ( Fig. 9A, B )...............................................................................................................................................
L. curvispinosa
sp. nov.

19 Pedipalpal femur normal; tibia with a strong mesial spur and 3 dorsal trichobothria ( Fig. 19A, B ); bulb large, median apophysis split into four needle ( Fig. 20B )...............................................................................
L. grandispina
sp. nov.

- Pedipalpal femur swollen; tibia without strong spur, tibial spur III and IV crossed and anear two distal spurs, 2 trichobothria ( Fig. 7A, B ); bulb small, median apophysis normal ( Fig. 8B )......................................
L. bama
sp. nov.

22. Palapl tarsus with a long mesial spur retrolaterally; 6 tibial spurs differed in size, spur I stubbed, spine II long and furcated; conductor rugose ( Fig. 28A, B ; 29B ) ................................................................................
L. jiulong
sp. nov.

- Pedipalpal tarsus without mesial spur retrolaterally; 6 tibial spurs same in size, no furcated; conductor smooth ( Fig. 24A, B ).......................................................................................................................................
L. hexacantha
sp. nov.

- Conductor and embolus not decussated; pedipalpal tarsus with a long mesial spur retrolaterally (figs 3, 4) ................ ......................................................................................................
L. quinquespinata ( Chen & Zhu, 2008 )
comb. nov.
